    • serialise

      private String serialise(Map<NetworkFieldEnum,Object> map)

    • deserialize

      private Map<NetworkFieldEnum,Object> deserialize(String JSONString)

    • addToMessage

      public void addToMessage(NetworkFieldEnum fieldName, Object messageObject)
      Adds an object to the outgoing message. Requires a field name If a field was set already, it gets overwritten
      Parameters:
      fieldName - The name used to identify the object
      messageObject - The object to be sent

    • readField

      public Object readField(NetworkFieldEnum fieldName) throws NullPointerException
      Returns the value of the given fieldName for the first SYNCHRONOUS inbound message, taken from the queue or null in case the message received doesn't have the specified field
      Parameters:
      fieldName - the field name of which one wants to know the value
      Returns:
      the value associated with that field, or null in case the field isn't present
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if there is no message read with the waitSyncMessage() method

    • readAsyncField

      public Object readAsyncField(NetworkFieldEnum fieldName) throws NullPointerException
      Returns the value of the given fieldName for the first ASYNCHRONOUS inbound message, taken from the queue or null in case the message received doesn't have the specified field
      Parameters:
      fieldName - the field name of which one wants to know the value
      Returns:
      the value associated with that field, or null in case the field isn't present
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if there is no message read with the waitAsyncMessage() method

    • waitSyncMessage

      public void waitSyncMessage() throws InterruptedException
      Waits for a new message on the synchronous message buffer Acts as a buffer between the queue and the list of messages received. Puts the first message from the Queue into the current incoming synchronous message To be called before any readField() is called
      Throws:
      InterruptedException - if the thread is interrupted before a message was available

    • waitSyncMessage

      public boolean waitSyncMessage(Integer waitTimeMillis) throws InterruptedException
      Waits for a new message on the synchronous message buffer Acts as a buffer between the queue and the list of messages received. Puts the first message from the Queue into the current incoming synchronous message, waiting for at most waitTimeMillis milliseconds before returning To be called before any readField() is called
      Parameters:
      waitTimeMillis - the maximum amount of time in milliseconds to wait before this method returns
      Returns:
      true if the polling was successful, false if the timer expired before a message was available
      Throws:
      InterruptedException - if the thread is interrupted before a message was available

    • waitAsyncMessage

      public void waitAsyncMessage() throws InterruptedException
      Waits for a new message on the asynchronous message buffer Acts as a buffer between the queue and the list of messages received. Puts the first message from the Queue into the current incoming asynchronous message To be called before any readAsyncField() is called
      Throws:
      InterruptedException - if the thread is interrupted before a message was available

    • flushFirstSyncMessage

      public void flushFirstSyncMessage()
      Removes the oldest received synchronous message from the incoming messages buffer.

    • flushFirstAsyncMessage

      public void flushFirstAsyncMessage()
      Removes the oldest received asynchronous message from the incoming messages buffer.

    • outFlush

      private void outFlush()

    • inFlush

      private void inFlush()

    • send

      public void send(OutputStream destinationOutput) throws IOException
      Send the message stored in the object as a JSON file to the specified output stream and then empties the message body for the next message to send
      Parameters:
      destinationOutput - the OutputStream of the host to send the message to
      Throws:
      IOException

    • receive

      public void receive(InputStream sourceInput) throws IOException
      Receives and stores the received message as an HashMap in the incoming message buffer This method blocks until the end of the json message is read
      Parameters:
      sourceInput - the InputStream of the host to read the message from
      Throws:
      IOException

    • convertListsToArrays

      private void convertListsToArrays(Map<NetworkFieldEnum,Object> deserializedMessage)
      Extremely crude way to circumvent gson deserialization behavior

    • isAsynchronous

      private boolean isAsynchronous(Map<NetworkFieldEnum,Object> deserializedMessage)
      An asynchronous message is a message sent by the server to the client when a client didn't specifically send a message first. An asynchronous message is characterized either by its request id, which will have different names depending on the type of message (specified in the relative Network field enumerator)
      Parameters:
      deserializedMessage - the message for which twe want to check its asynchronousness
      Returns:
      true if the message is asynchronous

    • checkFirstValidity

      @Deprecated public boolean checkFirstValidity() throws InterruptedException
      Deprecated.
      Checks if the first message in the buffer is in a valid format
      Returns:
      true if the message is valid, false otherwise
      Throws:
      InterruptedException

    • checkValidity

      private boolean checkValidity(Map<NetworkFieldEnum,Object> message)
      Checks if the message is in a valid format
      Parameters:
      message - The message to check
      Returns:
      true if the message is valid, false otherwise
